title: Devourer weaker than feral flare, rip farming playstyle, so much for strategic diversity.
body:
**Why flare was stronger:**
Feral flare gave 30% attack speed, 12 ad, 25 (+stacks) magic damage on hit (triple vs monsters for extremely fast clear times), 30% increased gold from monsters, 10 health on hit, a free ward to place every 180 seconds, and cost 1800 gold.

Devourer costs 450 gold more, loses the 12 ad, loses the triple magic damage vs monsters, loses the 10 health on hit, and 30% increased gold all for being able to straight up buy devourer 2 - 4 minutes before you'd have feral flare, a passive that gives far less sustain/clear speed, 20% more attack speed (worth about 168 gold more than the 12 ad you lost), and 30 extra gold/large monster.

However, the biggest thing that makes devourer worse is that you can only get ~half the stacks/minute because camps have double the timers they used to (with the exception of the buff camps of course). The only way get the stacks you used to is to snowball and get 2 stacks/champion, but devourer is a difficult item to snowball off of considering everything it lost in the first place. You also get far less gold off its passive because camps spawned twice as fast so you made use of the 30% gold increase twice as much.

**How the 100 second jungle respawn timers ruin strategic diversity:**

If you (the balance team) want junglers to have different strengths and weaknesses associated with a play style of ganking, farming, and counter jungling, why would you make it so that the jungler who constantly farms barely gets ahead in cs of the jungler who constantly ganks? That's effectively what happens when you have 100 second respawns on jungle camps and anyone with a decent clear speed has time to clear their entire jungle _and_ gank. You just can't get a noticeable cs lead anymore unless you tax laners.

Strategic diversity =/= tanks, 3 bruisers, and Nidalee since they all can clear the jungle and stay healthy enough to gank (and have strong ganks, as opposed to a traditional farm jungler like master yi who has very weak ganks due to no cc and low damage early game)

So.... Why was an item that was considered underpowered, (as it prevented jungler presence for your team early game and some of mid game) nerfed so hard?

**tl;dr**
The root of the jungle problems lies in the issue that there is no reward for focusing on farming when other junglers can keep up in farm just as much and snowball themselves or their laners off ganks easily. In other words, there is no reward for picking a different play style, as there is only one play style that works in the jungle and that's farming everything and ganking everyone hard.

**EDIT:**
It seems most people agree that a diversity of strategy and play styles is not a good thing if it means little interaction with other players. 

However, interacting with players via ganks on most devourer junglers guarantees little kill pressure unless the enemy was over extended so heavily and your laner has cc. Also, you would lose most 2 v 2s if the enemy jungler counterganks on a tank/bruiser.

So what if devourer was given a tool to increase gank pressure? I was thinking maybe after killing "x" large monsters the next champion you hit (or make it an active) will be rooted for x second(s) (could be a flat amount of monsters, or proportional to the stacks you aquire to make it weaker as the game progresses (although that'd be awkward because it'd also take more camps to charge the root as you gain stacks), it could even be a flat/proportional amount of stacks gained to gain root charges in team fights although that isn't what this buff is intended for, it's intended for ganking early and only that).

This would also make devourer jungler's ganks predictable if the enemy could see how many stacks they have, similar to an annie stun however, which could be good or bad depending on how strong the root would be.

**tl;dr of edit:** give devourer an active/on hit passive to root a champion for x seconds, active's cooldown resets after killing x camps or gaining x stacks (flat amount or proportional to stacks for either option).

Thanks for discussing whether you agree or disagree :)

replies.body: They've stated elsewhere that jungle farming needs to be held back because (A) a player being able to farm gold comparable to lanes uncontested and unmonitored leads to powerful champions getting fed really easily without any counterplay by the enemy and (2) Junglers need to be incentivized to gank and interact with other players. Hiding in the jungle farming PVE for 15-20 minutes would be boring as hell, frustrating for your allies, and a bad time for enemies who don't get the chances to gank deny and attack you the way they can lane farmers.

Regarding point A, I see the concern there but, you can't farm gold uncontested. The enemy can and should invade to either counter jungle or take advantage of you having a weak early game by trying to kill you and shut you down. 

Or, the enemy can take advantage of you having to farm and play more aggressive and the enemy jungler can snowball laners and put your entire team behind while you try to hit your powerspike. Which is probably easier and more effective than the former.

Regarding point B, while I don't disagree that you should be incentivized to gank, farm junglers really don't have the tools to gank. Warwick ganks pre  6 (or really pre flare, since that ult has like no base damage now) = lol, same thing for shyvana. Master yi ganks even post 6 are pretty sub par. The only devourer jungler I can think of who can capitalize off a gank opportunity somewhat well is udyr.

I hate when the jungler picks Warwick for exactly that reason. :(

The thing about counter-jungling is, you can't just automatically know where they are like you can lane farmers (since your minions give free vision). It's more labor intensive; you have to hunt down where they've been, ward key points, watch their trail. Your laners can't just abandon their lanes to scout and recon all the time to see if they can maybe find the enemy jungler.

Jungl;er is safer farm than lanes, so it needs to have it's goldflow from pure farming held in check.
What if smiting your own camp with {{item:3719}} gave vision on enemy version of the camp for ~45ish sec?
Wouldn't that basically reveal your location to the enemy if they see the vision hit? I mean, assuming this comes with some sort of notification to the enemy that is.

Well, You Been Warned was at least hitting on part of the problem: Poacher's Knife. It's the item that *should* be enabling the counterjungling that would help against farm junglers, but I think we can all agree that it's pretty damn useless right now. It'll be easier for Riot to balance all of these jungling styles once all of them actually work.

A big issue with feral flare was that it also killed diversity in the jungle. You were forced to pick a feral flare jungler and power farm so that you could carry your team to victory. There was no "strategic diversity" in never leaving the jungle, afk farming, then coming out at 20min. stronger then every enemy laner. Devourer needs to be tweaked but they should never be something that makes a jungler stronger then solo lanes from never leaving the jungle.

Here is the problem with devourer and old feral flare. Devourer rewards those that power farm the jungle and access their power spike through farm advantage, experience advantage and quicker access to core items ({{item:3153}} for example. That sounds like a very viable strategy and it is or once was. The issue that devourer brings is the lack of interaction the jungler brings to the game. The jungler is forced to afk farm their jungle in order to attain their power spike and try to carry the game after the 20 minute mark. The jungler PVE's for 20 minutes, while the rest of the 8 or 9 players are playing PvP. If Riot wants to balance devourer, the best way to balance it would be to give these "farm oriented" junglers incentive to gank a lane and interact within the Rift, rather than PvE for eternity. That is the only way to balance an item like devourer and I say this because of how unbalanced and broken Feral Flare was.

I've thought of a way to give an incentive to gank since many people seem to have the same opinion that farming so hard is an unhealthy play style and included it in my edit, I think my suggestion has potential to be OP but also a lot of room to balance it via duration/cooldown, the tl;dr version of my idea is: give devourer an active/on hit passive to root a champion for x seconds, active's cooldown resets after killing x camps (flat or proportional to number of stacks) or gaining x stacks (also can be flat or proportional to stacks). Thanks

I believe it has its purpose for certain playstyles, but its not a must buy on any of the champs that can use it.

The devourer farmers I played were typically {{champion:67}} {{champion:98}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:19}} {{champion:5}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:11}} 

Vayne: Blue Devourer for obvious reasons, max W, farm jungle and get a mix of physical/true/magic damage. Meaning you can build tanky after {{item:3153}}  and still do stupid damage lategame. Yet, I sometimes go Red Warrior and max Q, and gank twice as often. Both work.

Shen: I used to go Purple/Red Devourer because Juggernaut was meh, Mage gave less damage than I would've liked, Warrior was useless. It stacked nicely with shiv. But now Red Cinderhulk OP.

Cho: Same as Shen, because I play him tanky attack speed too.

WW: Devourer is the optimal (but not core) on him, for he runs Cinderhulk decently well too. There are other on-hit AS options for him that can still give  him damage (e.g. {{item:3091}} )

Xin: He ganks well without needing the power spike of Warrior, a cdr/tank Xin with a devourer as would have a better utility with comparable damage. Yet you get Warrior most of the time to snowball.

Jax: He uses both AP and AD, does both magic and physical, Warrior's physical pen is not fully used by him since he does a lot of magic damage too, and it's unwise to invest so heavily into a big AP item unless you're playing AP jax for Mage. Cinderhulk can work but most Jaxes need their damage early.

Yi: I'm conflicted about him. Devourer fits him so well because of how fast he farms jungle. Yet Warrior gives him the power spike he needs to gank earlier than Devourer does.

You're the bastard who plays Vayne jungle aren't you? I say with great pleasure, that I enjoy dunking you into oblivion every time you try to gank my lane. Vayne... jungle. BAH. Vayne... stupid more like it....

I won't deny that there are weaknesses (some jungler invades and certain laners). But she is not as helpless as you think in the jungle vs all invades, you should note that the jungle is SURROUNDED by terrain. Extremely easy to land a wall stun, and that's usually the winning factor Vayne in a duel, or at the very least, an escape. Shaco/Lee Sin/Rengar invades are threats for obvious reasons but other than that she can hold out against others (either escaping or duelling equally).

Besides, maybe you forgot, when a "gank" is happening, it usually means a 1v2. I know tunnel vision OP but you might want to watch what your enemy laner is doing besides eyeballing the jungler. Not that easy to dunk if you're being chain CC'd by a Nautilus or if you died after you got knocked into range for a Riven Nuke Combo. Unless you're fed as hell to 1v2 of course, in which case no jungler can help at that point.

Back on topic, I think they nerfed farmer junglers because tank junglers that brought CC to their ganks were weaker than a Devourer farmer that just bulldozed everyone at 20 mins if the laners just decided to play safe while he farms (the lanes remain equal while the jungler power is growing faster than the laners, safely too). 

I do believe they had the right idea though initially though, a farmer should be rewarded for farming fast to carry later, at the expense of early ganking power. The tank junglers had CC and good base damages for good early ganks that could snowball the lanes, they SHOULD pay for it with something else (i.e.  their clear speed sucking was perfectly reasonable in my opinion). But their clear was still too slow even considering that, and needed a buff, that I agree. However, they did receive a buff in the form of Cinderhulk, they clear reasonably fast, do respectable damage, are hard to kill, all while keeping their early ganking advantage over the Devourer farmers.

Maybe it's time to buff Devourer again? I notice that it does not really increase clear speed that much, perhaps the increased damage vs monsters passive can be reintroduced in a certain form? That would really make the distinction clearer between the power farmers and the gankers in my opinion.
I never said Vayne jungle was wrong or that it isn't a good idea, I just said I don't like people who do it.

Now, with Cinderhulk, the jungle has had immense diversity that it has only known since the early seasons where you could really play whoever the fuck you wanted in the jungle and do at least marginally well. So bitch, please.

Diversity of strategy. Not of champions. Before they buffed tanks, the only champions that could fulfill the strategy of farm everything and have strong ganks were Lee sin, Vi, Nidalee, Rek'sai, and Jarvan pre-nerfs. They buffed tanks and now they fulfill that strategy (better even because cinderhulk is broken). Champs that don't have both strong ganks early and are able to farm the jungle and stay healthy with a good clear time suffer immensely. So bitch, please ;>)

Nautilus doesn't have good clear time really, or good sustain. His ganks are really the only major redeeming factor about him. That and his plethora of CC to help lock down enemies. Shaco doesn't really have good sustain either, but nobody seems to complain about his jungling power. Udyr never really had great sustain in the jungle, but has pretty good ganks. Nobody complains about him. Where is this... absent group of junglers who do nothing but farm to increase in power? And don't you DARE say Master Yi... I hate that guy,

Your comment is really strange...
First: Nautilus and shaco have great sustain, especially shaco. Nautilus has a big shield, shaco has boxes and his E's passive to blind monsters. Udyrs that properly rotate turtle stance also have great sustain, but that can really just be done with blue buff.

Second: All those junglers you mentioned are out of meta.... because they aren't able to match the one play style of farming everything efficiently and having strong ganks nearly as well as the junglers we see most now. The only jungler out of those listed who does have potential to match that play style is a really good shaco, but shaco is also no where near as good in a team fight as tanks/bruisers who can initiate. Unless that shaco got fed and can assassinate the enemy team's carry (easily countered by a pink ward, so he most likely would have to resort to split pushing, call that strategic diversity if you'd like despite it not happening until 20 minutes). So why are you listing champions that have clearly defined inferiority because of the jungle changes to back up your argument that the jungle is diverse?

Third: And how did all those contradictions of yourself lead up to the unrelated question of who the junglers are who do nothing but farm to increase power? Well: Warwick, Shyvana, Nocturne, Kayle, and master yi (hate him all you want, he's a champion nonetheless). The only devourer junglers with high sustain/clear times and early gank potential are Aatrox and Udyr, but Aatrox's sustain is very limited, as it tends to sustain him no higher than half hp due to the passive on his W. Udyr's ganks are sub par unless he catches someone out over extended. His bear stance move speed isn't much... so he has a lot less gank pressure on someone in the middle of a lane than a champion with a dash/blink and cc.

Apologies if I misunderstood any part of your comment, and thanks for your thoughts.

It seems that we are on different though processes when it comes to jungle diversity, and I can see right now that we probably will never see what we are trying to show to each other. The way I think about the jungle, and the way you think about the jungle will never be able to come together over a screen, so I'm just going to cut this off right here. If I sounded hostile, I never really meant to and I apologize if I did. But I've been through enough arguments like this to know that nothing will really change. So while I don't agree with your logic, I can see where you are coming from. So here's an official goodbye from me.

Riot will not bring back the sustain nor the improvement to clear time, because that's what the season 5 jungle is all about. It's about rewarding certain junglers for their innate sustain and clear time abilities, and this part of Feral Flare is what made it really strong. Not many junglers can make use of 50% AS and on-hit magic damage better than they could make use of the stats on the other jungle items. It's a niche item now, and this is why Devourer is not chosen. It's not reliably good in a majority of situations.

I also want to point out that it starts out with twenty five stacks, and you don't have to farm up to that point. This means that at 7 - 8 minutes, you have stats on an item that are very, very good. Feral Flare never had this, because most people got their upgrade at eleven minutes in a good game. The item is not that bad, and I use it regularly in the jungle with a fair amount of success.
bump

I'm thinking they should just revert the nerf to Devourer. They nerfed Challenging Smite and WW so I see no problem in it. 40>25 = more incentive to gank earlier as you actually deal more damage. Right now, you have to farm so you can get enough power to pull off a gank. It is a really weak item right now and is keeping Yi, WW, and Nocturne out of the jungle. Nocturne CAN go Warrior and WW CAN go Cinderhulk; I know but they did so well with Devourer before it got nerfed.
